document_data.mainbody:
rows Foot was a hamlet at the foot of the city of Ravens Bluff, on the eastern shores of the Dragon Reach.
The hamlet was situated outside of the protective stone walls of the city, west of its Foreign District.The hamlet is not depicted in the map of Ravens Bluff in the Forgotten Realms Interactive Atlas, but the source is cited here for the sake of identifying the road.
Most of the buildings in the hamlet were built in an architectural style known on some worlds as "Tudor". Many were built of stucco, some simple stone, and thatched roofs were quite prominent. Narrow cart paths passed for streets in the hamlet and no torches were set out to illuminate them during the night. During the evening one could see the light of hearthfires and candles from the many windows of residents.
It was not uncommon to hear conch shells being blown during the night, either as a religious act towards Istishia during nights when the Veil was up or out of a local belief that doing so would ward off monsters.
The City Watch and Night Watch of Ravens Bluff oversaw the hamlets law enforcement, though things were usually quite peaceful in Crows Foot.
On a foggy night around the spring or fall season of the , a group of newly minted Night Watchmen patrolled the hamlet and had a myriad of encounters. First they saved a middle-aged woman, who was on her to slop the two pigs she kept in her backyard, from three mangy dogs. As they tried to leave Crows Foot to patrol Old Town they investigated a fireball and tremendous pyrotechnic display in the nightsky that were the cause of two wizards, Modo and Yvas, arguing over which of them had cast the spell that slayed a blue dragon back in their adventuring days.
In the , a group of fire worshipers emerged in Crows FootInferno in the Living City makes some references to the events of Nightwatch in the Living City, referring to them as having happened four years prior. As that module has been estimated to be set in 1355 DR, that would place the events of Inferno in 1359 DR. called the Cult of Red Ruin and established a temple close to the Red Sail Inn. Sometime later that year the cult found and trapped within an iron flask a pyre elemental. Over the next two weeks the cultists caused several fires in Ravens Bluff,
* Ravens Eye, formerly known as the Red Sail Inn, was an inn and tavern close to the outer wall. It was one of two taverns in the hamlet,Nightwatch in the Living City states there are at least two or more taverns in Crows Foot, though the name of this other tavern (or taverns) is never given. and most residents chose to flock to it instead of making the trek down to Old Town.
* Temple of Red Ruin, a marble temple near the Ravens Eye that was operated by the Cult of Red Ruin.
The hamlet was inhabited by many families, as well as merchants that worked in Old Town.
* Jack Harker, an old and semi-retired vampire hunter.
* Modo, a conjurer that ran an alchemical store in Old Town.
* Thomas and T.J., an orphaned child and his grandfather that lived in a cottage in Crows Foot in the mid-14 century DR.
* Yvas, an illusionist that ran a small scribe shop in Old Town.
